name: Griffith Observatory
description: One of the most famous public observatories in the world, offering spectacular views of Los Angeles and the cosmos. It's a gateway to the stars for millions of visitors.

name: Mauna Kea Observatory
description: Located atop a dormant volcano, Mauna Kea is one of the world's premier sites for astronomical research. Its high altitude and clear skies provide unparalleled viewing conditions.

name: Royal Observatory, Greenwich
description: Best known for being the location of the Prime Meridian, this historic observatory played a crucial role in the history of astronomy and navigation.

name: Very Large Telescope (VLT)
description: Operated by the European Southern Observatory (ESO), the VLT is the world's most advanced optical instrument, consisting of four large telescopes that can work together.
key_features: First direct image of an exoplanet

name: ALMA Observatory
description: The Atacama Large Millimeter/submillimeter Array (ALMA) is a state-of-the-art telescope that studies light from some of the coldest objects in the Universe.
key_features: Observes origins of stars and galaxies

name: Arecibo Observatory
description: Historically significant for its massive radio telescope, the Arecibo Observatory made groundbreaking discoveries in radio astronomy, planetary science, and SETI (Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence). Though the main telescope collapsed in 2020, its legacy endures.
key_features: First discovery of an exoplanet (pulsar planet)
Detailed radar maps of Venus and Mercury
The Arecibo Message sent to space in 1974

name: Palomar Observatory
description: Home to the famous 200-inch Hale Telescope, which was the largest in the world for 45 years. It has been central to our understanding of the scale of the universe and stellar evolution.

name: La Silla Observatory
description: Another major site of the European Southern Observatory (ESO), La Silla has been a bastion of astronomy in the Southern Hemisphere since the 1960s, contributing to countless discoveries.
key_features: High Accuracy Radial velocity Planet Searcher (HARPS)

name: Sydney Observatory
description: A heritage-listed museum and public observatory located on a hill directly overlooking Sydney Harbour. It combines history, science, and stunning views.
